meanings.definition: The quality of being able to provide a useful or valuable service.
meanings.sent1: The serviceability of the new tool impressed everyone in the workshop.
meanings.sent2: The serviceability of the phone was evident when it quickly connected to the internet.
meanings.sent3: The robot's serviceability was so good that it even made the coffee for the tired workers.
meanings.sent4: Her serviceability in organizing events was like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The serviceability of the flashlight during the blackout saved the day.

meanings.definition: The state of being in good working order or condition.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic checked the car's serviceability before the long road trip.
meanings.sent2: The serviceability of the computer was crucial for completing the project on time.
meanings.sent3: The serviceability of the old watch surprised everyone when it started ticking again.
meanings.sent4: His serviceability in fixing things around the house was like having a superhero at home.
meanings.sent5: The serviceability of the umbrella during the storm kept her dry and happy.
